ThingDef.label: diamond
ThingDef.description: A mineral composed of pure carbon. It is the hardest naturally occurring substance known; it is also the most popular gemstone. Because of their extreme hardness, diamonds have a number of important industrial applications.

ThingDef.label: amber
ThingDef.description: An organic gemstone, forming from the hardened resin of ancient pine trees. Much valued from antiquity to the present, amber is made into a variety of decorative objects.

ThingDef.label: pearl
ThingDef.description: A hard, glistening material produced within the soft tissue (specifically the mantle) of a living shelled mollusk or another animal, such as fossil conulariids. The finest quality of natural pearls have been highly valued as gemstones and objects of beauty for many centuries. It is fragile, but very beautiful.

ThingDef.label: ruby
ThingDef.description: An expensive blood-red colored gemstone that has accrued special and symbolic meaning through time.

ThingDef.label: emerald
ThingDef.description: A green-colored, highly precious gemstone. The gem is known to symbolize fidelity and true love.

ThingDef.label: almandine
ThingDef.description: A dark red gem belonging to the garnet group.

ThingDef.label: spessartine
ThingDef.description: An orange gem belonging to the garnet group.

ThingDef.label: rhodolite
ThingDef.description: A pink gem belonging to the garnet group.

ThingDef.label: tsavorite
ThingDef.description: An emerald-green gem belonging to the garnet group.

ThingDef.label: hessonite
ThingDef.description: An deep brown gem belonging to the garnet group.

ThingDef.label: demantoid
ThingDef.description: An emerald-green gem belonging to the garnet group.

ThingDef.label: melanite
ThingDef.description: A black gem belonging to the garnet group.

ThingDef.label: topazolite
ThingDef.description: A rare yellow gem belonging to the garnet group.

ThingDef.label: uvarovite
ThingDef.description: A very rare gem that is consistently deep green in color. Member of the garnet group. Its most widespread habit is as lustrous, tiny, emerald-green crystals densely coating a matrix.

ThingDef.label: amethyst
ThingDef.description: An affordable purple gem.

ThingDef.label: opal
ThingDef.description: A fragile gem formed from silica-rich waters.

ThingDef.label: sapphire
ThingDef.description: A precious gemstone. They are commonly known for their striking blue color.

ThingDef.label: onyx
ThingDef.description: A black gem.

ThingDef.label: topaz
ThingDef.description: A popular yellow gem.

ThingDef.label: moonstone
ThingDef.description: A blue opalescent gem.

ThingDef.label: quartz
ThingDef.description: One of the most abundant minerals. Quartz makes an excellent gemstone, since it is hard, durable, and usually accepts a brilliant polish.

ThingDef.label: zirconia
ThingDef.description: A natural gemstone popular for an astounding optical splendor that resembles a diamond.

ThingDef.label: lapis lazuli
ThingDef.description: A fragile gem valued for its deep blue colour.

ThingDef.label: malachite
ThingDef.description: A beautiful decorative stone. Its rich, patterned coloration in shades of green is unique among gems.

ThingDef.label: alexandrite
ThingDef.description: A rare gem well known for displaying one of the most remarkable color changes in the gem world — green in sunlight and red in incandescent light.

ThingDef.label: ametrine
ThingDef.description: A gem that combines It combines the purple of amethyst and the golden color of citrine.

ThingDef.label: aquamarine
ThingDef.description: One of the most popular blue gemstones.

ThingDef.label: citrine
ThingDef.description: A pale yellow quartz resembling topaz.

ThingDef.label: iolite
ThingDef.description: A blue gemstone.

ThingDef.label: kunzite
ThingDef.description: A pink gemstone.

ThingDef.label: morganite
ThingDef.description: A light pink gemstone.

ThingDef.label: peridot
ThingDef.description: A green gemstone. It glows a brilliant green under artificial light.

ThingDef.label: spinel
ThingDef.description: A singly refractive and very transparent gemstone found in deep brick red color.

ThingDef.label: sunstone
ThingDef.description: A gem that shows an opaque "schiller" effect where the metallic inclusions reflect light in a blaze of color.

ThingDef.label: tanzanite
ThingDef.description: A blue gem which appearance is influenced greatly by its ability to show colors when viewed from different directions.

ThingDef.label: rubellite
ThingDef.description: A transparent red gemstone, variety of tourmaline.

ThingDef.label: dravite
ThingDef.description: A greenish-brown gemstone, variety of tourmaline.

ThingDef.label: liddicoatite
ThingDef.description: A type of tourmaline that has a pink center and green perimeter around the outside, resembling a watermelon and it's rind.

ThingDef.label: elbaite
ThingDef.description: A blue coloured gem, variety of tourmaline.

ThingDef.label: indicolite
ThingDef.description: A light blue coloured gem, variety of tourmaline.

ThingDef.label: siberite
ThingDef.description: A violet coloured gem, variety of tourmaline.

ThingDef.label: paraiba
ThingDef.description: Gem known for its bright neon colours, variety of tourmaline.

ThingDef.label: verdelite
ThingDef.description: A green coloured gem, variety of tourmaline.

ThingDef.label: olive tourmaline
ThingDef.description: Variety of tourmaline with a unique olive-green color.

ThingDef.label: achroite
ThingDef.description: A transparent variety of tourmaline that displays no color. It is the most rare variety of tourmaline, but it isn't expensive due to low demand.

ThingDef.label: chrome tourmaline
ThingDef.description: Variety of tourmaline with a vivide green color.

ThingDef.label: schorl
ThingDef.description: A lustrous black mineral, most common form of tourmaline.

ThingDef.label: turquoise
ThingDef.description: Opaque blue gem.

ThingDef.Name: TMaterials_ZirconBase
ThingDef.description: A natural, semi-precious gemstone, available in a many colors.

ThingDef.label: ammolite
ThingDef.description: An opal-like organic gemstone made of the fossilized shells of ammonites.

ThingDef.label: andalusite
ThingDef.description: A gold colored highly pleochoric gem.

ThingDef.label: apatite
ThingDef.description: A gem known for its asparagus green color.

ThingDef.label: red coral
ThingDef.description: An intensely colored red skeleton of marine red corals, used for making jewelry.

ThingDef.label: carnelian
ThingDef.description: A cheap brownish-red mineral that is commonly used as a semi-precious gemstone.

ThingDef.label: goshenite
ThingDef.description: A highly transparent colorless gem.
